meanings.definition: The quality or state of being similar or equivalent in value or worth.
meanings.sent1: The comparability of the two paintings made it hard to choose the better one.
meanings.sent2: The comparability of the two cars made it easier to decide which one to buy.
meanings.sent3: The comparability of the two desserts led to a fun taste test among friends.
meanings.sent4: The comparability of their skills was like two sides of the same coin.
meanings.sent5: The comparability of the twins was so striking that even their parents had trouble telling them apart.

meanings.definition: The ability to be compared or likened to something else.
meanings.sent1: Her comparability to a cheetah in speed was impressive to all who saw her run.
meanings.sent2: The comparability of his intelligence to that of a computer was uncanny.
meanings.sent3: The comparability of the situation to a comedy of errors made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The comparability of her voice to an angel's was often remarked upon.
meanings.sent5: The comparability of the mountain to a sleeping giant was a common local legend.
